snippet: A videotaped statement from Pedro Hernandez, the man who confessed to killing Etan Patz in 1979, was made public for the first time on Monday. His lawyer argued that the statement is a false confession.
abstract: Videotaped statement from Pedro Hernandez, man who confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, is made public for the first time at hearing in Manhattan's State Supreme Court; his lawyer seeks to have confessions thrown out, suggesting his client, who has IQ of about 70 and history of mental illness, gave false or coerced confession.
lead_paragraph: A videotaped statement from Pedro Hernandez, the man who confessed to killing Etan Patz in 1979, was made public for the first time on Monday. His lawyer argued that the statement is a false confession.

headline.main: Confession in Etan Patz’s Killing: ‘I Tried to Stop, but I Couldn’t’
headline.print_headline: In Patz’s Killing, ‘I Tried to Stop, but I Couldn’t’
